feed.title: Time to worry about 80-bit collision attacks or not?

entry.title: Time to worry about 80-bit collision attacks or not?
entry.summary: On 10th January 2016, Rusty shared information about the bitcoin network. Apparently, it is doing a lot of work every 57 days, amounting to approximately $92 million. However, he mentions that there is a possibility of SHA2 being weakened in the future, similar to what happened with SHA1. He points out that having industry standard safety margins would make such weakening an academic problem rather than an emergency.
